hmm.complexity: O(T × N²) where T = time steps, N = states

interpretation: Row 0: From Free Flow - 70% stay, 25% → Congested, 5% → Gridlock
Row 1: From Congested - 20% → Free Flow, 60% stay, 20% → Gridlock
Row 2: From Gridlock - 10% → Free Flow, 35% → Congested, 55% stay

emission_model.assumption: Speed and PM2.5 conditionally independent given state

monte_carlo.purpose: Uncertainty quantification for freight tax health benefits
monte_carlo.sampling_method: Independent random sampling from Gaussian distributions

elasticity_of_demand.meaning: Price elasticity - how truck volume changes with cost

pm25_dispersion.meaning: PM2.5 concentration change from truck removal
pm25_dispersion.source: EPA Air Quality Studies, local meteorology

concentration_response.meaning: Asthma risk reduction per µg/m³ PM2.5 decrease
concentration_response.source: NYC Community Health Survey, EPA ISA

outputs: Probability Density Function (PDF) for health outcomes
95% CI for error bars on visualizations
limitations: Gaussian distributions may not capture tail risks
Does not account for temporal correlations

pathfinding.purpose: Model truck routing behavior with freight tax
pathfinding.complexity: O(E log V) where E = edges, V = nodes

rationale: Time delays from traffic calming measures

network.coverage: Cross-Bronx Expressway and Soundview residential area

pathfinding.addresses_exclusion: Truck routing through residential streets (from model assumptions)
